did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle:
Papers of the President of the University of Virginia, Office Administrative Files
1941-1942

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Access restrictions may apply to specific student records under the terms of the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (F.E.R.P.A.).

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of the President of the University of Virginia, Office Administrative Files, Accession #RG-2/1/2.531, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: These files constitute the major record series generated by the president of the University of Virginia. The records consist chiefly of correspondence, but also include reports, minutes, clippings, memoranda, and related papers concerning all areas of business of the president's office.

did.unittitle: Alumni Office--Alumni Board of Trustees of the UVa. Endowment Fund 1941-1942

American Council on Education: American Association of University Professors, American Peace Society, History of Science Society, American Arbitration Society, American Association of Political and Social Science 1941-1942
"B" Miscellaneous (1 of 2)--correspondence re: Page-Barbour lectures; Paul Barringer correspondence re: Law Library needs; J. Barron II correspondence re: Naval History in N.C. 1941-1942
Biology, Department of--Blandy Farm--records, history, report of the committee 1941-1942
Buildings and Grounds--Box Bushes--Stettinius' gift of 1941-1942
Buildings and Grounds--Home for Crippled Children 1941-1942
Building Program--Power Plant and Heating Mains 1941-1942
Carnegie Corporation--Money for Music Department; Randall Thompson and Mrs. Tuttle 1941-1942
Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Teaching 1941-1942
Committee on Public Occasions--Atcheson Hench, chair 1941-1942
"D" Miscellaneous--correspondence of Virginius Dabney re: the University and the South 1941-1942
Dean Ferguson--papers re: Committee on Academic Legislation 1941-1942
Emergency Committee in Aid of Displaced Foreign Scholars 1941-1942
Extension Division--Drama 'taught thru' state; Wm. Smith manuscript sent to Rockefeller Foundation 1941-1942
"G" Miscellaneous--Galt sketches for statue of Jefferson given by nieces of Galt; Glazebrook, first tennis courts at UVa. 1941-1942
Institute of Public Affairs--Wendell Wilkie speaking, introduced by President Newcomb 1941-1942
"M" Miscellaneous--correspondence of Mayhoff, Mrs. re: Deed to Monticello 1941-1942
Medicine, Department of--addition to Urology Department 1941-1942
Medicine, Department of (1 of 2)--Hospital--Ward Patient Reports 1941-1942
Medicine, Department of (2 of 2)--Hospital--Ward Patient Reports 1941-1942
Medicine, Department of--Rucker Convalescent Home for Crippled Children 1941-1942
National Association of State Universities--University of Wyoming case 1941-1942
"P" Miscellaneous--Pi Delta Epsilon, petition for course in journalism turned down 1941-1942
Physics, Department of--Mr. Sparrows book to be published; replacement for Mr. Sparrow is sought; Strauss report on high voltage presented 1941-1942
Political Science, Department of--notes difficulty in replacing men in service 1941-1942
"R" Miscellaneous--Rosenwald Fund--lists recipients both black and white; Raven Society--new members 1941-1942
Rural Social Economics, School of --reports from Blacksburg and UVa. 1941-1942

"S" Miscellaneous (1 of 3)--President Sanger of Medical College of Virginia: plans joint communications with UVa. to promote cooperation; Selective Service: in all fields above; Survey of Albemarle and adjacent counties 1941-1942
Senate--University--gives plans for vacations and academic credit 1941-1942
Southern Association of Colleges and Secondary Schools 1941-1942
Summer Quarter workshop in education is planned 1941-1942
"T" Miscellaneous--Tunstall, Robert--correspondence; Trigg, R. P.--public health course for blacks and whites needed 1941-1942
Virginia Bureau of Industrial Research--Records and Reports 1941-1942
Virginia Quarterly Review--war-time difficulties due to leaves; final break with Dutton 1941-1942
"W" Miscellaneous--Wallace, Henry--speech; Weddell, Alexander--publication of "Life of Jane Porter"; Wertenbaker, Thomas--correspondence 1941-1942
